name: Ram Ghat
description: One of the main bathing ghats on the banks of the Shipra River, famous for the Kumbh Mela. Pilgrims believe a sacred dip here cleanses sins and brings spiritual merit.

name: Mahakaleshwar Temple
description: This ancient temple houses one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, revered as the most sacred abodes of Lord Shiva. It's believed to be self-manifested (svayambhu).

name: Harsiddhi Temple
description: A historic temple dedicated to Goddess Harsiddhi, a powerful form of Annapurna. It is one of the 51 Shakti Peeths, significant for devotees seeking divine blessings.

name: Triveni Ghat
description: The sacred confluence of three rivers: Shipra, Saraswati (mythical), and Khan. It's a major bathing spot during Snan days and offers a serene atmosphere.

name: VIP Parking Zone A
description: Designated VIP parking area offering convenient access for special guests. This zone helps streamline vehicle movement during peak times.

name: Public Parking Zone B
description: Large parking area serving the general public and pilgrims, designed to accommodate a high volume of vehicles and reduce city congestion.

name: Central Medical Camp
description: The main medical facility equipped for emergencies, providing essential healthcare services and first aid to all visitors and pilgrims.

name: Sector 4 Medical Point
description: A satellite medical help point located strategically to offer quick medical assistance within walking distance of key areas.
